name: Provisioning Subtab Guide
title: Provisioning Subtab Guide
body:
You can use Active Directory Integration (ADI) or the System for Cross-Domain Identity Management (SCIM) to bulk import users and add optional information about your users. If you use ADI or SCIM, you can view the results of your user provisioning syncs in the Provisioning subtab. To access the Provisioning subtab, log in to your KSAT console and navigate to Users > Provisioning.

See below for an overview of the Provisioning subtab.

  1. Service: Click the drop-down arrow to filter all user provisioning syncs by the provisioning service used. You can filter by ADI, SCIM, Legacy SCIM, or All.
  2. Status: Displays the sync status and how much data the provisioning has collected. There are four types of statuses:
    1. Pending - a sync has started, and provisioning is waiting for the data.
    2. Processing - provisioning has started collecting data and processing any changes to the users or groups.
    3. Completed - provisioning has finished collecting data, and users have been updated if applicable.
    4. Skipped - provisioning detected a misconfiguration between the settings in the console and the user data it was given, causing it to skip the sync.
  3. Groups, Users, and Memberships: Displays the number of groups, users, and memberships that the provisioning service created, archived, restored, or managed.
  4. Service: View the provisioning service used for each sync, such as ADI or SCIM.
  5. Test Mode: Indicates whether or not test mode was on when the sync occurred. Test mode reports what changes would be made without making the changes.
  6. Details: Click this button for more information about the specific sync. When you click this button, you'll be taken to a page with details about your sync. For more information about this page, see the below screenshot.

  1. Groups, Users, and Memberships: View the three different categories that were covered by your provisioning sync.
  2. Archived, Changed, Created, and Restored: View the different subsections that can appear depending on your sync.
  3. Sync Status: Click this drop-down arrow to filter your subsections. You can filter by Successful, Failed, or All.
  4. Sync and Error Details: Click this link to download a JSON file with the ADI sync changes and detailed error information. This file may not include all the information provided on the Provisioning subtab of your KSAT console.

You can view up to 30 sync reports in the Provisioning subtab. If you have run more than 30 syncs, the oldest syncs will be deleted. For example, if you have run 30 syncs and decide to sync one more time, the first sync that you ran will be deleted from the Provisioning subtab.

After a sync report has been available for 30 days, you will no longer have the option to click the Details button for that report.

images.alt:
This image displays a **Provisioning** log interface, likely within a User Management or Admin panel, detailing synchronization activities.

**Header/Navigation:**
The main navigation bar shows several tabs, with **Provisioning** highlighted as the active tab. Other tabs include: Users, Groups, Import Users, Merge Users, Messages, and Security Roles.

**Service Context and Configuration:**
A line item confirms the status of the integration: "Active Directory Integration (ADI) is enabled in Account Settings." This is preceded by a Windows logo icon.
A dropdown menu labeled **Service:** is set to **All**.

**Provisioning Log Table:**
The primary content is a sortable data table tracking synchronization attempts.

**Table Columns (with corresponding labels):**
1. **Sync Received**
2. **Status**
3. **Groups** (includes a sorting icon and a help icon)
4. **Users** (includes a sorting icon and a help icon)
5. **Memberships** (includes a sorting icon and a help icon)
6. **Service** (includes a help icon)
7. **Test Mode** (includes a help icon)
8. **Action** (Implicit - containing the "Details" button)

**Table Data (Rows):**

| Sync Received | Status | Groups | Users | Memberships | Service | Test Mode | Action |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **10/28/2023** | Completed (Green tag) | 6 | 241 (with **6 errors** red tag) | - | Active Directory | Test (Red tag with flask icon) | Details (Blue button) |
| **01/09/2023** | Completed (Green tag) | 7 | 299 | - | Active Directory | (Empty) | Details (Blue button) |
| **01/08/2022** | Completed (Green tag) | - | 5 | 1 | Active Directory | (Empty) | Details (Blue button) |

**Key UI Features:**
*   Status tags use color coding: Green for **Completed**, Red for **errors** and **Test** mode designation.
*   Help icons (?) are present on most column headers to provide definitions.
*   The "Details" button allows users to view comprehensive information for each sync event.
*   The first log entry explicitly shows that the synchronization ran in **Test Mode** and encountered **6 errors** during the user provisioning phase.
images.context:
p>
See below for an overview of the Provisioning subtab.

images.alt:
This screen displays the "User Provisioning Sync Reports" interface, indicating that **Test Mode was enabled** (marked by a flask icon).

**Main Navigation and Context:**
The interface features primary navigation tabs, with the **Provisioning** tab currently active. The header includes a link back to "User Provisioning."

**Synchronization Summary:**
The report shows data from a sync received on "10/14/2021, 9:56 AM." A detailed summary row indicates counts for different entities:
*   Groups: 3
*   Users: 1586 (Successful) and 6510 (Issues, marked in red).
*   Memberships: 2490
A clickable link, "Sync and Error Details," is available for further information. A critical notification button is present, stating: **"❗ There were 6510 issues."**

**Filtering and Status Breakdown:**
A set of secondary filters divides the user results by action, with **Changed (1167)** currently selected and highlighted. Other filters include Archived (1), Created (6844), and Restored (84).

A teal contextual banner confirms the data shown: "List of users that existed and would have been changed by SCIM."

**Data Table:**
The displayed list is filtered by a dropdown labeled "Sync Status: All." The table includes the following columns: Name, Email, Manager, GUID (with a tooltip/help icon), Changed Fields, and Error. The first visible entry is for "Marry Marshmallow," whose changed field is listed as "Phone number."
images.context: For more information about this page, see the below screenshot.
